intro: Praecereus, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a genus of cacti native to South America. These plants are characterized by their spiny stems and large, showy flowers that open at night. The flowers are typically white or pale pink and emit a strong fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Praecereus species are succulent plants that store water in their thick stems, allowing them to thrive in arid environments. They are popular among cactus enthusiasts for their unique appearance and dramatic nighttime blooming.
